items.title: Joshua: Fight me Fury, if you're a real bad boy!
items.summary: Anthony Joshua reiterated his desire to finally fight Tyson Fury after he had knocked out Jake Paul in Miami.

items.title: England on brink of Ashes series defeat after late collapse in pursuit of record target
items.summary: England are on the brink of an Ashes series defeat inside 11 days' play after they stumbled to 207-6 in pursuit of a Test-record 435 to win the third Test in Adelaide.

items.title: FC Porto pal achter Farioli: 'Het gaat hier om een vertrouwenscrisis'
items.summary: FC Porto heeft een statement naar buiten gebracht over de kwaliteit van de arbitrage in Portugal. Eerder uitte trainer Francesco Farioli felle kritiek op de scheidsrechter van de wedstrijd tussen FC Porto en Famalic√£o. Porto steunt zijn opvatting volledig en meent dat er een groter probleem is.

items.title: Het Ajax-sprookje van Grim: ‚ÄòCruijff zag het best wel in mij zitten‚Äô
items.summary: Voetbal International viert dit jaar zijn zestigjarig jubileum. Naar aanleiding daarvan herplaatsen we elke dag in het weekeinde een verhaal uit ons rijke archief. Deze keer gaan we terug naar augustus 1999, als VI‚Äôs Frans van den Nieuwenhof uitgebreid aan tafel gaat zitten met Fred Grim. De doelman zit dan al vijf jaar bij Ajax, heeft met de Amsterdammers alles gewonnen wat er te winnen valt, maar w√©l steeds als reserve. Door het vertrek van Edwin van der Sar naar Juventus is hij eindelijk de nummer 1 onder de lat. Een boeiend gesprek met de toekomstige (interim-)trainer van Ajax.

items.title: Arteta on Arsenal future: I have to earn new deal

items.title: PSG GK fractured hand during shootout heroics
items.summary: Paris Saint-Germain goalkeeper Matvey Safonov has been left with a fractured hand following his penalty shootout heroics to win the Intercontinental Cup.

items.title: Man City 'must prepare' for successor, says Guardiola
items.summary: Pep Guardiola says Man City "must be prepared" to plan for his eventual departure, after Enzo Maresca says reports suggesting he could succeed the Spaniard are "100% speculation".

items.title: Maresca plays dangerous game as confusion reigns after his Chelsea grenade
items.summary: Club remain bemused by head coach creating speculation he has issues with the hierarchy who want to avoid drama at all costs One of the theories doing the rounds this week is that Enzo Maresca is behaving like someone who wants to be sacked. He has stumbled into a fight he cannot win. It did not go down well with Chelsea when Maresca lobbed a grenade into the mix by talking about not being supported enough after last Saturday‚Äôs humdrum win against Everton and it is hard not to read his refusal to defuse the situation since then as the stance of a man daring his bosses to act. Chelsea remain bemused by their head coach creating speculation that he has issues with the club‚Äôs hierarchy by saying that the 48 hours before the Everton game had been his worst since joining the club. Sources say the outburst even caught people close to Maresca by surprise. Confusion reigns. It does not help that Maresca has publicly and privately rejected repeated opportunities to explain the source of his discontent, leaving it open for outsiders to assume that the Italian‚Äôs issues are with Chelsea‚Äôs hierarchy. Continue reading...

items.title: Thomas Frank talks sense but Tottenham‚Äôs lack of style has supporters worried
items.summary: Dane wants time but before Saturday‚Äôs match against Liverpool, faithful are frustrated by stodgy performances There are plenty of well-known checkpoints in the life cycle of a Tottenham manager and we have reached one with Thomas Frank. It is the pleading for time bit. ‚ÄúIf nobody gets this, nobody will be able to turn this around,‚Äù he said after last Sunday‚Äôs 3-0 Premier League defeat at Nottingham Forest. It is not a ‚Äúquick fix,‚Äù he added. And nobody was about to disagree. Frank is veering towards another ‚Äì the one where it is as if he wants to scream, to release the inner hurricane that he referenced in Nottingham. Is anybody seeing what he is seeing? In other words, the immense difficulties that he faces. Continue reading...

items.title: Mikel Arteta admits long-term future at Arsenal dependent on winning silverware
items.summary: Spaniard approaches sixth anniversary in charge Arteta ‚Äòhas to earn the right to be here tomorrow‚Äô Mikel Arteta has conceded his long-term future at Arsenal is dependent on winning silverware as he prepares to celebrate his sixth anniversary in charge. The Spaniard was appointed on 20 December 2019 and led Arsenal to the FA Cup a few months later but that remains his only major trophy since replacing Unai Emery. Arteta will mark six years in the job against his former club Everton on Saturday night ‚Äì the same opponents Arsenal faced a day after he was announced as their manager. He watched that game from the stands before officially beginning his role the next day. Continue reading...
